result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanda Jo Wilk

defendant.name: Wilk, Shanda Jo
defendant.address: 539 S. Wasson Lane Apt 204, River Falls, WI 54022

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Release/Modification/Change in Sentence. Approved for 4 days. Signed by RMW on 8/21/2015. km
to REvoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction Agreement. Filed by ADA Hahn. km
filed by Attorney Amann stating ADA Gehler's jail credit summary is correct except for one add'l time period, which he is looking into.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb,ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Shanda Jo Wilk appeared.  Court called at 4:47 p.m.  Includes case 14CF243, 14CF286, 14CF301, 14CF488, 14CF501 & 14CM305.  ADA Gehler advises the court the State is recommending a 36 month Diversion Agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the court.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF243 and Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 14CF286.  Crt informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF243 but withholds sentence due to deferred judgment and Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 14CF286. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses  but reads in for purposes of restitution Ct 2 in 14CF243 and Ct. 2. in 14CF286 and all counts in 14CF301, 14CF488, 14CF501 & 14CM305.  Court signs the Diversion Agreement.  Court adjourned at 5:17 p.m.  lw

S/W 2 years probation with conditions on Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 on 14CF286
- AODA with follow through
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Report to probation by 12:00 p.m. on 11/24/14
- Court waives all court costs and DE to pay $200.00 for DNA surcharges on Ct 1 and Ct. 3 on 14CF286
- Attorneys send letter to court with jail credit.
- 20 days to appeal
from Defendant stating she has no way to get to the jail for a UA today. eif

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann, DF:  Shanda Jo Wilk appeared.  Court called.  Includes 14CF286, 14CF243, 14CF301 & 14CM305.  Attorney Amann advises the court they are working towards a resolution.  Set 14CF243 for trial.   Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at  1:17 p.m. lw  Jury trial scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann. DF: Shanda Jo Wilk appeared.  Court called at 3:07 p.m.  Includes 14CF286, 14CF243, 14CF301 & 14CM305.  Information filed on 14CF286 and on 14CF301.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights on 14CF286 and 14CF301. Defendant understands.  DE pleads N/G on the 3 counts in 14CF286 and to the 1 Count in 14CF301 and to the 2 counts in 14CF243.  Bond continues in form and amount on all files.  DE is asking if she can get her testing in Woodville instead of SCC.  DE's mother is looking into it and get information to ADA Hahn and if there is no objection the court will allow.  Court adjourned at 3:15 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
J.A. had telephone conference with Jail Srgt. Kohen, Judge Cameron granted permission for Ms. Wilk to give her U.A. on 8/19/14 due to jail staff on high demand with intake. kl

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA:  Amer L. Hahn, DF ATTY:T Gregory Amann, DF:  Shanda Jo Wilk appeared. Includes 14CF286, 14CF243, 14CF301 & 14CM305  Court called at 11:19 a.m.  ADA Hahn asks court if witness can appear by phone.  Court approves telephone testimony.  Attorney Amann requests witnesses be sequestered.  S/T of Cathy Bakkestuen.  Direct by ADA Hahn.  Cross by Attorney Amann.  Witness excused.  S/T of Rebecca Hill.  Direct by ADA Hahn.  DE is identified by Ms. Hill.  Cross by Attorney Amann.  Witness excused.  S/T  Karen Hotvedt of Royal Credit Union's fraud department.  Plaintiff's EX. 1 (check) O/R EX. 2 (check) O/R   Witness exused.  S/T of Officer Ryan Miller of the River Falls Police Department.  Witness excused. Direct by ADA Hahn. Witness identified. Called case 14CF286.  S/T of Investigator Jim Mikla of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department.  Direct by ADA Hahn.  DE identified by Investigator Milkla.  Cross by Attorney Amann.  Witness excused.  ADA Hahn asks court to take Judicial Notice of the bond in 14CF243.  No objection from Attorney Amann.  Court finds probable cause on case 14CF243 and 14CF286 and binds the DE over for trial. Attorney Amann asks the court to amend the bond.  Court modifies the bond to a $2,500 signature bond.  Will continue to have UA testing at SCSO.  Court adjourned at 11:58 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

UA at SCSO every Monday by  5:00 p.m. DE to pay $5.00 fee

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Rocco DeBerardino.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.  

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Nicholas Sroka. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
Arraignment on August 11, 2014 at 11:15 am.
